meanings.definition: A type of tree native to Australia.
meanings.sent1: The karris tree provides shade in the hot Australian sun.
meanings.sent2: I love the smell of the karris tree in the forest.
meanings.sent3: Why did the koala climb the karris tree? To take a nap!
meanings.sent4: The karris tree stood tall like a guardian of the outback.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the karris tree rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: The act of carrying or transporting something.
meanings.sent1: She struggled with the karris of groceries from the store.
meanings.sent2: The karris of books was heavy on his back.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the karris of laundry up the stairs felt like a workout.
meanings.sent4: The karris of responsibility weighed on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: He managed the karris of boxes with ease, showing his strength.

meanings.sent1: Mr. Smith introduced himself as John Karris.
meanings.sent2: The Karris family had a reunion every summer.
meanings.sent3: Karris was a unique surname that always sparked conversation.
meanings.sent4: The name Karris echoed through the halls of the school.
